intro: Rhytachne gracilis, commonly known as the slender rhytachne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
